ygData.subject: RE: What about the lvl 24 song?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... YES! Like me? :) In some places, the surrounding is as dark for my wood elf druid and my half elf bard as for my Erudite enchanter. Night vision does NOT
ygData.messageBody:
>Hmmm I do not think the recently deceased Human who is bumping
>around in the
>dark would agree with you here... Also people with dark video equipment
>(graphics card and/or monitor) find this useful as well.

YES!
Like me? :)
In some places, the surrounding is as dark for my wood elf druid and
my half elf bard as for my Erudite enchanter. Night vision does NOT
work as well on a darker system (or maybe its because I am playing
on a laptop)

I can even play Human with little problems on my friend's computer.
Even at nighttime, in most zones they are fine. (zoning out of BB to
Everfrost is a problem)

>>Identify
>Try to complete the Lambent armor quests without this one. Also i have a
>feeling that many more quests will have items in the future that
>need to be identified.

Last night Windsong, lvl 50 bard, was using this song to identify whether
an item was part of a quest or not. This also identifies the parts of the
Runes. Sure, its not always memmed. But when you need it, its good to
have.

>Just because you find something useless does not mean the rest of
>us do. I
>know of people that even find Disenchanting Melody useful. Usually in a
>Melee heavy group without a buffer from what I have heard.

And I've heard PvP servers consider Mellifluous Melody as essential as well.

Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Meara, level 14 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faerain, level 18 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 8 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro
(Blackburrow)
